name: 吳和庭
objective: 本課程包含機率複習與隨機程序的基礎原理及應用,如機率量測,隨機變數,大數法則,隨機變數參數之估計,隨機程序原理,穩態隨機程序,隨機程序特性及隨機訊號處理。本門課程為研究所在通訊、訊號處理及控制領域之基本課程。
schedule:
Week 1. Reviews of Probability Concepts
Week 2. (Single and Multiple) Random Variables
Week 3. Sequential Events, Conditional Probability and Conditional Expectation
Week 4. Functions of Random Variables; Sums of Random Variables
Week 5. Moment Generating Functions, Central Limit Theorem and its  Applications
Week 6. Midterm 1; Sample Mean
Week 7. Point Estimates of the Model Parameter; Confidence Intervals
Week 8. Significance Testing
Week 9. Binary and Multiple Hypothesis Testing
Week 10. Estimation of Random Variables; Optimal Estimation
Week 11. MAP and ML Estimation
Week 12. Miderm 2; Definitions and Types of Random Processes
Week 13. The Poisson Process; The Brownian Process
Week 14. Stationary and Wide Sense Stationary Random Processes
Week 15. Linear Filtering of Random Processes
Week 16. Linear Prediction of Random Processes
Week 17. Power Spectral Density of Random Processes
Week 18. Final Exam
scorePolicy:
1.　　Homework Sets (a few)               20%
2.　　Two Mid Terms                 25%*2=50%
3.　　Final Exam.                         30%
materials:
Prerequisites: Probability, Transform Theory
Textbook:  Yates and Goodman, “Probability and Stochastic Processes,” 2nd Ed., John Wiley & Sons, 2005.
References:
1.　　Leon-Garcia, “Probability and Random Processes for Electrical Engineering,” 2nd ed., Addison-Wesley, 1994.
2.　　Childers, “Probability and Random Processes”, Irwin, 1997.
3.　　Papoulis and Pillai, “Probability, Random Variables, and Stochastic Processes,” 4th ed., Mc-Graw-Hill, 2002.
4.　　Stark and Woods, “Probability and Random Processes with application to Signal Processes”, 3rd ed., Prentice Hall, 2002.
5.　　Ross, “Introduction to Probability Models”, 7th ed., Academic Press, 2000.
6.　　Ghahramani, “Fundamentals of Probability with Stochastic Processes”, 3rd ed., Prentice Hall, 2005.
7.　　Bhat and Miller, “Elements and Applied Stochastic Processes”, 3rd ed., 2002.
8.　　Ross, “A First Course in Probability”, 6th ed., Prentice -Hall, 2002
